content:
TITLE: Basic FastAPI-MCP Setup
DESCRIPTION: Minimal code example demonstrating how to integrate the MCP server with a FastAPI application. This code imports the necessary components, initializes a FastAPI app, creates an MCP server instance, and mounts it to the FastAPI app at the '/mcp' endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

app = FastAPI()

mcp = FastApiMCP(app)

# Mount the MCP server directly to your FastAPI app
mcp.mount()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic usage of FastAPI-MCP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the simplest way to add an MCP server to a FastAPI application using FastAPI-MCP. It creates a FastAPI app, initializes FastApiMCP with the app, and mounts the MCP server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/README_zh-CN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

app = FastAPI()

mcp = FastApiMCP(app)

# Directly mount the MCP server to your FastAPI app
mcp.mount()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering Endpoints in FastAPI-MCP
DESCRIPTION: Shows various ways to control which FastAPI endpoints are exposed as MCP tools using operation IDs and tags. Includes examples of inclusion and exclusion filters, and combining multiple filtering criteria.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/04_advanced_usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

app = FastAPI()

# Only include specific operations
mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    include_operations=["get_user", "create_user"]
)

# Exclude specific operations
mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    exclude_operations=["delete_user"]
)

# Only include operations with specific tags
mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    include_tags=["users", "public"]
)

# Exclude operations with specific tags
mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    exclude_tags=["admin", "internal"]
)

# Combine operation IDs and tags (include mode)
mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    include_operations=["user_login"],
    include_tags=["public"]
)

mcp.mount()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Customizing Schema Description in FastAPI-MCP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure schema description options when initializing FastAPI-MCP. Controls the detail level of tool descriptions and response schemas.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/04_advanced_usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

app = FastAPI()

mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    name="My API MCP",
    describe_all_responses=True,     # Include all possible response schemas in tool descriptions
    describe_full_response_schema=True  # Include full JSON schema in tool descriptions
)

mcp.mount()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Advanced usage of FastAPI-MCP with custom schema description
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize the MCP server creation with options for including all possible response schemas and full JSON schemas in tool descriptions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/README_zh-CN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

app = FastAPI()

mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    name="My API MCP",
    describe_all_responses=True,     # Include all possible response schemas in tool description
    describe_full_response_schema=True  # Include full JSON schema in tool description
)

mcp.mount()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing OAuth Flow in FastAPI-MCP with Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to implement the full OAuth 2 flow in FastAPI-MCP, compliant with MCP Spec 2025-03-26.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/03_authentication_and_authorization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import Depends
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP, AuthConfig

mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    name="MCP With OAuth",
    auth_config=AuthConfig(
        issuer=f"https://auth.example.com/",
        authorize_url=f"https://auth.example.com/authorize",
        oauth_metadata_url=f"https://auth.example.com/.well-known/oauth-authorization-server",
        audience="my-audience",
        client_id="my-client-id",
        client_secret="my-client-secret",
        dependencies=[Depends(verify_auth)],
        setup_proxies=True,
    ),
)

mcp.mount()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Separate Deployment Configuration in FastAPI-MCP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create an MCP server from one FastAPI app and mount it to a different app for separate deployment. Useful for isolating MCP functionality from the main API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/04_advanced_usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

# Your API app
api_app = FastAPI()
# ... define your API endpoints on api_app ...

# A separate app for the MCP server
mcp_app = FastAPI()

# Create MCP server from the API app
mcp = FastApiMCP(api_app)

# Mount the MCP server to the separate app
mcp.mount(mcp_app)

# Now you can run both apps separately:
# uvicorn main:api_app --host api-host --port 8001
# uvicorn main:mcp_app --host mcp-host --port 8000
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Customizing exposed endpoints in FastAPI-MCP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates various ways to control which FastAPI endpoints are exposed as MCP tools, using operation IDs and tags for inclusion or exclusion.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/README_zh-CN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

app = FastAPI()

# Include only specific operations
mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    include_operations=["get_user", "create_user"]
)

# Exclude specific operations
mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    exclude_operations=["delete_user"]
)

# Include only operations with specific tags
mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    include_tags=["users", "public"]
)

# Exclude operations with specific tags
mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    exclude_tags=["admin", "internal"]
)

# Combine operation IDs and tags (inclusive mode)
mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    include_operations=["user_login"],
    include_tags=["public"]
)

mcp.mount()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Dynamic Endpoint Addition in FastAPI-MCP
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to handle adding new endpoints after MCP server creation by refreshing the server configuration. Includes example of adding a new endpoint and updating the MCP server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/04_advanced_usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

app = FastAPI()
# ... define initial endpoints ...

# Create MCP server
mcp = FastApiMCP(app)
mcp.mount()

# Add new endpoints after MCP server creation
@app.get("/new/endpoint/", operation_id="new_endpoint")
async def new_endpoint():
    return {"message": "Hello, world!"}

# Refresh the MCP server to include the new endpoint
mcp.setup_server()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Custom HTTP Client Configuration in FastAPI-MCP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure custom HTTP client settings for FastAPI-MCP communication. Shows setup of custom base URL and timeout settings using httpx.AsyncClient.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/04_advanced_usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import httpx
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

app = FastAPI()

# Use a custom HTTP client with a specific base URL
custom_client = httpx.AsyncClient(
    base_url="https://api.example.com",
    timeout=30.0
)

mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    http_client=custom_client
)

mcp.mount()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Customizing communication with FastAPI application
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use a custom httpx.AsyncClient for communication between the MCP server and the FastAPI application, allowing for custom base URLs or different transport methods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/README_zh-CN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import httpx
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

app = FastAPI()

# Use a custom HTTP client with a specific base URL
custom_client = httpx.AsyncClient(
    base_url="https://api.example.com",
    timeout=30.0
)

mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    http_client=custom_client
)

mcp.mount()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Custom OAuth Metadata in FastAPI-MCP with Python
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to provide custom OAuth metadata for full control over the OAuth configuration in FastAPI-MCP.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/03_authentication_and_authorization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import Depends
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP, AuthConfig

mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    name="MCP With Custom OAuth",
    auth_config=AuthConfig(
        # Provide your own complete OAuth metadata
        custom_oauth_metadata={
            "issuer": "https://auth.example.com",
            "authorization_endpoint": "https://auth.example.com/authorize",
            "token_endpoint": "https://auth.example.com/token",
            "registration_endpoint": "https://auth.example.com/register",
            "scopes_supported": ["openid", "profile", "email"],
            "response_types_supported": ["code"],
            "grant_types_supported": ["authorization_code"],
            "token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported": ["none"],
            "code_challenge_methods_supported": ["S256"]
        },

        # Your auth checking dependency
        dependencies=[Depends(verify_auth)],
    ),
)

mcp.mount()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring FastAPI-MCP with AuthConfig in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to set up FastAPI-MCP with AuthConfig to reject requests without an authorization header.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/03_authentication_and_authorization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import Depends
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP, AuthConfig

mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    name="Protected MCP",
    auth_config=AuthConfig(
        dependencies=[Depends(verify_auth)],
    ),
)
mcp.mount()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying MCP server separately from FastAPI application
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to create an MCP server from one FastAPI application and mount it on a separate application, allowing for independent deployment of the API and MCP server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/README_zh-CN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

# Your API app
api_app = FastAPI()
# ... define your API endpoints on api_app ...

# A separate MCP server app
mcp_app = FastAPI()

# Create MCP server from the API app
mcp = FastApiMCP(api_app)

# Mount the MCP server to the separate app
mcp.mount(mcp_app)

# Now you can run the two apps separately:
# uvicorn main:api_app --host api-host --port 8001
# uvicorn main:mcp_app --host mcp-host --port 8000
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring AuthConfig with Proxies in FastAPI-MCP using Python
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to set up AuthConfig with proxies for OAuth provider compatibility in FastAPI-MCP.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/03_authentication_and_authorization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
mcp = FastApiMCP(
    app,
    auth_config=AuthConfig(
        # Your OAuth provider information
        issuer="https://auth.example.com",
        authorize_url="https://auth.example.com/authorize",
        oauth_metadata_url="https://auth.example.com/.well-known/oauth-authorization-server",

        # Credentials registered with your OAuth provider
        client_id="your-client-id",
        client_secret="your-client-secret",

        # Recommended, since some clients don't specify them
        audience="your-api-audience",
        default_scope="openid profile email",

        # Your auth checking dependency
        dependencies=[Depends(verify_auth)],

        # Create compatibility proxies - usually needed!
        setup_proxies=True,
    ),
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding endpoints after MCP server creation
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to refresh the MCP server to include new endpoints added to the FastAPI application after the initial MCP server creation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/README_zh-CN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi_mcp import FastApiMCP

app = FastAPI()
# ... define initial endpoints ...

# Create MCP server
mcp = FastApiMCP(app)
mcp.mount()

# Add new endpoint after MCP server creation
@app.get("/new/endpoint/", operation_id="new_endpoint")
async def new_endpoint():
    return {"message": "Hello, world!"}

# Refresh MCP server to include new endpoint
mcp.setup_server()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Comparing Auto-Generated vs Explicit operation_id in FastAPI Routes
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates two approaches to defining FastAPI endpoints: one with an auto-generated operation_id (which results in a cryptic tool name) and another with an explicit operation_id that produces a clearer tool name ("get_user_info"). The explicit approach is recommended for better clarity when working with FastAPI-MCP.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/01_tool_naming.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# Auto-generated operation_id (something like "read_user_users__user_id__get")
@app.get("/users/{user_id}")
async def read_user(user_id: int):
    return {"user_id": user_id}

# Explicit operation_id (tool will be named "get_user_info")
@app.get("/users/{user_id}", operation_id="get_user_info")
async def read_user(user_id: int):
    return {"user_id": user_id}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining FastAPI endpoints with and without explicit operation_id
DESCRIPTION: Compares two FastAPI endpoint definitions, one using an automatically generated operation_id and another with an explicitly defined operation_id. This affects how the MCP tools are named.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/README_zh-CN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# Automatically generated operation_id (something like "read_user_users__user_id__get")
@app.get("/users/{user_id}")
async def read_user(user_id: int):
    return {"user_id": user_id}

# Explicit operation_id (tool will be named "get_user_info")
@app.get("/users/{user_id}", operation_id="get_user_info")
async def read_user(user_id: int):
    return {"user_id": user_id}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring MCP Client for OAuth Flow in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This JSON configuration shows how to set up an MCP client to use OAuth flow with FastAPI-MCP.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/03_authentication_and_authorization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "fastapi-mcp": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": [
        "mcp-remote",
        "http://localhost:8000/mcp",
        "8080"
      ]
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring SSE Connection for MCP Clients
DESCRIPTION: Basic configuration for connecting popular MCP clients like Claude Desktop, Cursor & Windsurf to a FastAPI MCP server using Server-Sent Events (SSE).
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/02_connecting_to_the_mcp_server.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "fastapi-mcp": {
      "url": "http://localhost:8000/mcp"
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring MCP-Remote Bridge Connection
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for connecting to MCP server using mcp-remote as a bridge, supporting authentication and providing compatibility for clients that don't support SSE directly. Includes optional port configuration for OAuth support.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/02_connecting_to_the_mcp_server.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "fastapi-mcp": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": [
        "mcp-remote",
        "http://localhost:8000/mcp",
        "8080"
      ]
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring MCP Client with Fixed Port for OAuth in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This JSON configuration shows how to set up an MCP client with a fixed port for proper OAuth callback URL configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/03_authentication_and_authorization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "example": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": [
        "mcp-remote",
        "http://localhost:8000/mcp",
        "8080"
      ]
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring MCP Client for Token Passthrough in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure an MCP client to send an authorization header for basic token passthrough.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/03_authentication_and_authorization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "remote-example": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": [
        "mcp-remote",
        "http://localhost:8000/mcp",
        "--header",
        "Authorization:${AUTH_HEADER}"
      ]
    },
    "env": {
      "AUTH_HEADER": "Bearer <your-token>"
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running MCP Inspector CLI Command
DESCRIPTION: Command to launch the MCP Inspector tool for testing and verifying FastAPI MCP server functionality. The inspector allows connecting to the MCP server and testing available endpoints.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/00_FAQ.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector node build/index.js
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: FastAPI-MCP Example Structure
DESCRIPTION: List of example files demonstrating different aspects of FastAPI-MCP implementation, including basic integration, schema customization, endpoint management, and configuration options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/examples/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# FastAPI-MCP Examples

The following examples demonstrate various features and usage patterns of FastAPI-MCP:

1. [Basic Usage Example](01_basic_usage_example.py) - Basic FastAPI-MCP integration
2. [Full Schema Description](02_full_schema_description_example.py) - Customizing schema descriptions
3. [Custom Exposed Endpoints](03_custom_exposed_endpoints_example.py) - Controlling which endpoints are exposed
4. [Separate Server](04_separate_server_example.py) - Deploying MCP server separately
5. [Reregister Tools](05_reregister_tools_example.py) - Adding endpoints after MCP server creation
6. [Custom MCP Router](06_custom_mcp_router_example.py) - Advanced routing configuration
7. [Configure HTTP Timeout](07_configure_http_timeout_example.py) - Customizing timeout settings
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing FastAPI-MCP Using UV
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing the FastAPI-MCP package using uv, a fast Python package installer. UV is the recommended installation method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
uv add fastapi-mcp
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing FastAPI-MCP using uv package manager
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to install FastAPI-MCP using the recommended uv package manager. uv is described as a fast Python package installer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/README_zh-CN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
uv add fastapi-mcp
```

----------------------------------------

SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install fastapi-mcp
```

TITLE: Installing FastAPI-MCP using pip

TITLE: Setting up FastAPI-MCP Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands for cloning the repository and setting up the upstream remote for contribution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/fastapi_mcp.git
cd fastapi-mcp

# Add the upstream remote
git remote add upstream https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp.git
```

TITLE: Installing Development Environment

SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Pre-commit Hooks
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing and running pre-commit hooks to ensure code quality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Commands with Virtual Environment
DESCRIPTION: Commands for running development tools with activated virtual environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
source .venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: .venv\Scripts\activate

# Then run commands directly
pytest
mypy .
ruff check .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Commands without Virtual Environment
DESCRIPTION: Commands for running development tools using uv run prefix without activating virtual environment.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Use uv run prefix for all commands

uv run mypy .
uv run ruff check .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Commands for adding runtime and development dependencies using uv package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
uv add new-package
uv add --group dev new-package

git add pyproject.toml uv.lock
git commit -m "Add new-package dependency"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changelog Entries in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Structured changelog entries documenting version history from 0.1.0 to 0.3.2, including breaking changes, fixes, features and improvements to the FastAPI MCP project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [0.3.2]

### Fixed
- üêõ Fix a bug preventing simple setup of [basic token passthrough](docs/03_authentication_and_authorization.md#basic-token-passthrough)

## [0.3.1]

üöÄ FastApiMCP now supports MCP Authorization!

You can now add MCP-compliant OAuth configuration in a FastAPI-native way, using your existing FastAPI `Depends()` that we all know and love.

### Added
- üéâ Support for Authentication / Authorization compliant to [MCP 2025-03-26 Specification](https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-03-26/basic/authorization), using OAuth 2.1. (#10)
- üéâ Support passing http headers to tool calls (#82)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for Auth0 Example
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the required environment variables for the Auth0 integration example in FastAPI-MCP.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tadata-org/fastapi_mcp/blob/main/docs/03_authentication_and_authorization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
AUTH0_DOMAIN=your-tenant.auth0.com
AUTH0_AUDIENCE=https://your-tenant.auth0.com/api/v2/
```
